title: Add 12 new Physical State moods with matching emojis

requirements.text: Extend the Motoko backend `Mood` variant type in `backend/main.mo` to include these 12 new moods so the generated frontend `Mood` enum stays in sync: `#thirsty`, `#dehydrated`, `#sleepy`, `#wired`, `#sore`, `#bloated`, `#overheated`, `#cold`, `#headache`, `#nauseous`, `#lightheaded`, `#restless`. Also extend `module Mood.toText` to return the corresponding English labels (including the exact label text "Wired (too much caffeine)" for `#wired`).
acceptanceCriteria: `backend/main.mo` compiles with the new `Mood` variants added to the `Mood` type.
`Mood.toText` returns correct English labels for all 12 new moods, including exactly "Wired (too much caffeine)" for `#wired`.
Frontend type generation/build does not fail due to missing/unknown `Mood` variants.

acceptanceCriteria: The MoodPicker shows all 12 new moods grouped under the "Physical State" category.
Daily Check-In mood selection and Compose mood selection both display the new moods with the specified emojis.
TypeScript build passes (the new entries reference valid `Mood.*` enum values generated from the backend).

constraints: Backend must remain a single-actor Motoko canister; keep all logic in `backend/main.mo`.
Do not edit any frontend files under the immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose read-only UI components instead of modifying them).
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Do not add any additional moods beyond the 12 specified.
Do not change existing mood categories, existing mood labels/emojis, or mood picker UX beyond adding the new options.
